text:
Using (Nightly?) Build 2.1.31012006, i have spotted what appears to be a bug in
the Cookie Manager.

class: org.apache.jmeter.protocol.http.control.CookieManager.java
line: ~251 or 252
function: getCookieHeaderForURL(url)

If the url protocol is not HTTP && not HTTP, return (ie do not get cookies from
the header).  This means that any cookies in headers received over a HTTPS
connection will not be parsed.  In turn, this prevents JMeter from maintaining a
session that is initiated after the SSL handshake.

I believe this check should 'not HTTP && not HTTPS'.

(note: i have made this change on my local code, and it appears to work)
creator: willinghamg@hotmail.com
sebb@apache.org
text: Thanks! I'll take a look at that.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Oops! looks like an error introduced when strings were replaced by constants.

I've committed a fix to SVN; it will appear in the next nightly (and the next 
release).

Thanks for reporting this and finding the problem. 
I think you've probably solved bug 38702 as well.
